title: Ruth Negga wears ACLU blue ribbon on Oscars 2017 red carpet
text:
Ruth Negga wears ACLU blue ribbon on Oscars 2017 red carpet Annie Brown twitter TWEET More 
Best actress nominee Ruth Negga arrived on the Oscars red carpet looking knockout in a fire engine red Valentino gown. With its high neck and long sleeves it's a nifty reminder that you can make an impact without flashing any skin. 
However it was the blue ribbon that the actress wore that caught attention. According to The Hollywood Reporter , the ribbon is part of the American Civic Liberties Union' "Stand with ACLU" initiative. SHARE Ruth Negga wears an ACLU ribbon as she arrives at the Oscars. Photo: Richard Shotwell 
The organisation, which works to protect people's rights and liberties, launched the campaign encouraging the A-list to stand in solidarity with the work that they do. 
Ahead of the Oscars the group reached out to nominees to ask them to wear the blue ribbon on the red carpet and show their support. Photo gallery Oscars 2017: red carpet 
Negga, who is nominated for Best Actress for her role in Loving has another connection with the ACLU. Loving is based on the true story of an interracial couple, Mildred and Richard Loving, who were defended by the ACLU after they were arrested in Virginia in 1958. The case went to the Supreme Court and ended America's marriage racial segregation laws. 
Casey Affleck, who is nominated for Best Actorfor Manchester by the Sea , wore one of the ribbons on his lapel to the Film Independent Spirit Awards on Saturday. SHARE
